byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Brit Hudson bomber pilot describes return to base in damaged plane
snippet: LONDON, Aug. 31--Air Ministry officials are boasting of the performance of American-built planes following the return of a Hudson bomber to its base despite the fact that its nose had been shot off and all windows in the pilot's cabin blown out....

headline.main: AMERICAN PLANES PRAISED BY BRITISH; Air Ministry Boasts After the Return of Hudson Bomber With Nose Shot Off NAVIGATOR SAVED PILOT Craft Was Saved From Crash by Joint Effort on Controls During Swift Dive

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 31--Air Ministry officials are boasting of the performance of American-built planes following the return of a Hudson bomber to its base despite the fact that its nose had been shot off and all windows in the pilot's cabin blown out.
